Warmup

Noisefest Warmup 2023

🐊 🦤 🐉 🦕 🦎
Saturday, 29 April 2023
Doors: 20h00
Start: 21h00
at SPXLXNKX [Leipzig-Plagwitz]
🦣 🦖 🐢 🌋 🐲
on stage:
Pieuvre {Brln}
Berlin trio patching together raw, no wavey guitars, a punk-funk like rhythm section and well-crafted vocal melodies.
Untel {Fr}
The music Untel generates is an odd one - a threshold towards some sunken worlds, some would say, or the celebrating of an unknown deity's wedding.
PLS {Fr}
PLS is an electronic trio of 100% machines. They propose a music at the crossroads of several styles - between melodic synths, techno rhythms and saturated songs.
Fatique Suspecte {Lpz}
A duo combining experimental breakcore/techno with ambient and noise undertones, equally matching for outdoor raves and the dirty basement of some diy punk squat.

Workshops

Gleeetch Noise Riot Workshop

Thursday 1.6. @exblackhammer
17h00-22h00
This time the plan is to come together for crafting noise machines on 1.06 and the next day (2.06) to jam with it at the Noise fest before the main lineup starts. We will set it up on the floor with the audience. Participants of course have choice to join or not and its open for anyone who like to join spontaneously. For the workshop: Bring your music toys, amplify, modify and play them on the Noise fest (if you want). Anything goes such as toy synths , guitars, radios, tape players, guitar pedals etc. We will learn to wire an audio jack and also find new sounds from these machines or bring whatever non-electronic that can produce a noise - we can wire a piezo mic and a audio cable to it! You can also expect a Practical introduction to circuit bending aka modifying music toys and building new instruments from them. Are you interested in circuit bending, nerding, recycled electronic music toys and having fun with sound? Then come along!!! No experience needed! We especially want to encourage the flinta* community to participate!
Register: gl333tch@riseup.net
Level: noob
Donation: 5-10€
Material to bring: yourself, toys , tools like screwdrivers, solder, irons, hot glue gun, components, audio cables etc (for an easier and comfier experience for everyone)
Participants: 10
Here is the bible of circuit bending if you wanna come more prepared ;)

From Scratch To Patch
Modular music with VCV Rack

Friday 2.6. @exblackhammer
15h00-19h00 + open end
Make your first steps in the world of Modular Synthesizer with VCV Rack. A free and open-source software synthesizer, with over 2000 free modules to explore. All You need is a laptop and headphones, to create your first (virtual) Rack. In this workshop you will be introduced to the basic modules, such as VCO, VCA, LFO and more. Michi (Das Konstrukt) will guide you through the functionality of the software and build with you your first NOISE patch(finished setup of connected modules). For this workshop you need a laptop and headphones. (If available any kind of MIDI controller is helpful and fun, otherwise Michi will bring some.) Pre-install VCV (free) before if you wanna come more prepared ;) or get an offline installation at the workshop.
Register: gl1txhttt@gmail.com
Level: noob
Donation: 5-10€
Participants: 10

DIY means Do It Yourself!
Lötworkshop mit noisio

Saturday 3.6.
@exblackhammer 13h00
Baue dir beim noisio Lötworkshop deinen eigenen 8-Bit Mini-Synthesizer. Zum Beispiel das Photonotron - ein licht-sensitives Theremin, mit dem du Klänge zwischen Retro und Chaos erzeugen kannst. Oder die ATtiny Punk Console, welche sich über ein Audiosignal programmieren lässt. Ebenso ist der 10-stimmige LevitationOSC dabei - ein Drone-Synthesizer mit mannigfaltigen Sounds und Funktionen, sowie bestimmt der ein oder andere Bausatz aus dem noisio Reisekoffer...
Mehr unter: www.noisio.de
Preise: 20€–60€
Anmeldung unter
noisefest@riseup.net
